head.supplied: Melbourne, 17/6/76 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have been desired by the Trustees of the Royal Park, in reply to your letter addressed to the Hon. T. J. Sumner our chairman, to inform you that my colleagues would be ...

div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter & minute book, p.59, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I have been desired by the Trustees of the Royal Park, in reply to your letter addressed to the Hon. T. J. Sumner our chairman, to inform you that my colleagues would be ready to receive a deputation from the Agricultural Society on Tuesday next, the 20th. inst. at half past two p.m. in the office room of the Acclimation Society, 69 Temple Court.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Secretary to the Agricultural Society of Victoria
The Victorian Agricultural Society wished to propose that an area of about 25 acres of the Royal Park facing Flemington Road at the city end be made over to the Society as an Agricultural Show Reserve; see minutes of the meeting of the Trustees, 16 June 1876. See also M to W. MacFarlane, 22 June 1876.
